thread.title: Men’s Basketball: SG Long commits to ISU
thread.title_full: Men’s Basketball: SG Long commits to ISU

title: Men’s Basketball: SG Long commits to ISU
text:
Men’s Basketball: SG Long commits to ISU Men’s Basketball: SG Long commits to ISU By Travis Hines thines@amestrib.com 
Jakolby Long, a 2016 guard, has committed to play men’s basketball at Iowa State. 
“Coach (Steve) Prohm and his assistants just have great relationships with the players,” Long said Friday in a phone interview with the Ames Tribune. “I loved the campus (during an official visit last week). 
“It felt like home.” 
A 6-foot-4 shooting guard from Mustang, Okla., Long also had scholarship offers from the likes of Kansas State, Missouri and Oklahoma State, among others. 
“I’m a lefty, streaky shooter,” Long said of his style of play. “And I really play defense.” 
Long spent last weekend in Ames on his official visit. He said the fan support the program receives was evident and a factor in his decision. 
“They show a lot of love to the players,” he said. 
The Cyclones’ work ethic also made an impression on him. 
“I was able to watch practice, and they show a lot of enthusiasm,” Long said. “They’re intense every single day.” 
Long joins prep forward Solomon Young along with junior college players Donovan Jackson and Emmanuel Malou in ISU’s 2016 class, which will be pivotal for Prohm as the roster for this year’s preseason top-10 team rolls over with four senior starters plus a possible NBA decision from junior Monte Morris. 
“(The coaching staff) said I’ll be able to play a lot, probably 20-plus minutes a game,” Long said. “Hopefully I’ll be able to start my freshman year. 
“We’ll be young and inexperienced next year, but I think we’ll be able to continue to win in the Big 12.” 
ISU currently has two scholarships remaining for next season.
